byline.original: By LANDON THOMAS Jr., LIZ ALDERMAN and AURELIEN BREEDEN

abstract: French court rules International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Lagarde is guilty of misusing public funds when she was France's finance minister but does not impose fine or sentence; IMF says it remains confident in Lagarde's leadership despite verdict.
lead_paragraph: With the International Monetary Fund facing populist criticism and at a critical juncture, Ms. Lagarde was found guilty of charges linked to her time as France’s finance minister.
snippet: With the International Monetary Fund facing populist criticism and at a critical juncture, Ms. Lagarde was found guilty of charges linked to her time as France’s finance minister....

headline.main: I.M.F. Stands by Christine Lagarde, Convicted of Negligence
headline.print_headline: Lagarde Is Convicted of Negligence, but I.M.F. Still Supports Her
